title: Visitors crawl to Bug Day
content: None   David Bordelon, 7 and sister Kinsley Bordelon, 3, look at bees brought by the Cenla Beekeeping club at The 11th annual Bug Day, hosted by Kent House and the U.S. Forestry Service, held Saturday, June 2, 2018 at Kent Plantation House. Visitors were able to touch some insects such as the Madagascar hissy cockroach as they learned about various insects and reptiles at the event. They were also able to eat bugs such as crickets and mealworms which were in dishes such as Rice Krispies Treats, chocolate chirp brownies and honeybutter hot and spicy mealworm. After eating the treats, visitors earned an "I Ate a Bug" button. Melinda Martinez
